translated: In the Middle Ages, the fief was the reward that the superior lord (the suzerain) gave the vassal that is to say the person who agreed to put themselves at his service.
original: Au Moyen Âge, le fief était la récompense que le seigneur supérieur (le suzerain) accordait au vassal c'est-à-dire la personne qui acceptait de se mettre à son service.
